thread.title: ALERT: We Just Discovered Who’s Behind Effort to Stop Trump’s “Muslim Ban”… and It’s Not Good
thread.title_full: ALERT: We Just Discovered Who’s Behind Effort to Stop Trump’s “Muslim Ban”… and It’s Not Good

author: Nickarama
title: ALERT: We Just Discovered Who’s Behind Effort to Stop Trump’s “Muslim Ban”… and It’s Not Good

organizations.name: advisory board of the international migration initiative of soros
jerome n. frank legal services organization

text:
PJ Media raises an interesting question. 
After President Donald Trump’s executive order immediately went into effect, suddenly hundreds of people showed up at various airports across the country. 
Where did these people almost instantaneously come from? 
They acted almost as though they were a coordinated effort… 
From PJ Media: 
The flurry of anguished news stories and protests surrounding President Trump’s executive action temporarily suspending “immigrants and non-immigrants” from “countries of particular concern” appears to be part of a coordinated PR effort financed by left-wing billionaire George Soros. 
Rather than a complete “Muslim ban” as promised during the campaign, Trump’s executive order contains moderate refugee restrictions, similar to those that have been implemented by President Obama. 
Looking at groups involved in the lawsuit in New York to stop the ban, they can be tracked to Soros. 
The suit was filed by lawyers from the International Refugee Assistance Project, the National Immigration Law Center, the Jerome N. Frank Legal Services Organization at Yale Law School, the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU), and the International Refugee Assistance Project (formerly Iraqi Refugee Assistance Project) at the Urban Justice Center. 
The ACLU is massively funded by Soros’s Open Society Foundations, including with a $50 million grant in 2014. 
The National Immigration Law Center has received numerous Open Society grants earmarked for general support. 
The Urban Justice Center is also the recipient of an Open Society grant. 
Taryn Higashi, executive director of the Center’s International Refugee Assistance Project, which is listed on the Trump lawsuit, currently serves on the Advisory Board of the International Migration Initiative of Soros’s Open Society Foundations. 
Groups at the protests could also be traced to Soros. 
According to PJ Media, “Make the Road” is also a far left group funded by Soros. 
It’s one thing to disagree on policy and legitimately protest. 
It’s another to continually fund people and groups who riot and/or cause chaos, as Soros does. LIKE this article?
